programme.desc: The story of Baltimore Ravens' 2000 Super Bowl success over New York Giants at the Raymond James Stadium in Tampa, Florida. programme.desc: England v Pakistan. Coverage of the first day of the Third and Final Test in the series, taking place at The Ageas Bowl in Southampton. This will be the concluding Test of the summer for England, which also began at this venue when they hosted West Indies in July, a match that resulted in a four-wicket loss. The omission of Stuart Broad from the side on that occasion proved to be an error of judgement that was quickly rectified, and with Ben Stokes currently unavailable for personal reasons, experienced players such as Broad, Jimmy Anderson and captain Joe Root could be pivotal in claiming victory here.(n)

programme.title: EFL Cup Final 12: Cardiff City v Liverpool
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the showpiece match at Wembley Stadium, where the winner of the first major trophy of the 2011/12 season was decided. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset.(n)

programme.title: EFL Play Off Final C'Ship 16/17: Huddersfield Town v Reading

programme.title: EFL Play Off Finals League 2 12/13: Bradford City v Northampton Town: 2012/13
programme.desc: Bradford City v Northampton Town. Action from the 2012/13 League Two play-off final at Wembley Stadium, where promotion to League One awaited the winners. The Bantams were making their second appearance of the season at Wembley having also reached the League Cup final following an outstanding giant-killing run, and they needed to come from behind to edge out Burton Albion to reach this stage. The Cobblers ended a run of recent poor form to win 1-0 in both legs of their semi-final against Cheltenham Town to move within one match of reaching the third tier of English football.(n)

programme.title: Live Test Cricket
programme.sub-title: England v Pakistan: Third Test Day One 21.08
programme.desc: England v Pakistan. Coverage of the first day of the Third and Final Test in the series, taking place at The Ageas Bowl in Southampton. This will be the concluding Test of the summer for England, which also began at this venue when they hosted West Indies in July, a match that resulted in a four-wicket loss. The omission of Stuart Broad from the side on that occasion proved to be an error of judgement that was quickly rectified, and with Ben Stokes currently unavailable for personal reasons, experienced players such as Broad, Jimmy Anderson and captain Joe Root could be pivotal in claiming victory here.(n)
